review: Pros:• It took about 3 minutes to set up out of the box.• It automatically switches my television over to the Chromecast whenever I stream something to it.• Easy to use and I can play just about anything I want on it, from either my computer, phone or iPad.• Multiple people can play things in turn, from different devices.  Good for family time.Cons:The app support is still limited but that will change in time and this will not be an issue.All in all this is a great device and I feel that the industry is moving in this general direction.

review: This was a Christmas gift to my husband from a family member. We really weren't sure what it was until we set it up, but soon realized what all the hoopla is about. This was very easy to install and activate. We were watching videos within minutes on our living room TV, and loving it!! We loved it so much that we bought one for the bedroom TV! This would be a great gift for anyone and everyone!
author: Amazon Customer

review: I was one of the first to order and receive the Chromecast when Google released it, and was lucky enough to score their promotional price through Amazon of about $15 as a surprise during checkout.This thing is just great. Just get it. For $35, what this does is a steal. It's simple to use, quick, and makes watching Netflix, HBOGO, Hulu Plus, YouTube, and Google Play sweet when it's casted over to your HDTV. I would easily pay up to $50 for this product without flinching. Google has made an excellent piece of hardware.The only thing that isn't readily apparent from all the pictures of it is that it requires a source of power. It comes with a USB cord that attaches, and most modern HDTVs and stereo systems have a USB port to plug in for power. Just be aware of that in case you have an older HDTV and may not have a USB nearby.

author: Mark D. Deschner

review: I received this for Christmas, and it has lived up to being an amazing stocking stuffer.  I have an old Dell Latitude laptop, and when I attempted to download the app I was told to consider another device.  I moved on and downloaded on my smartphone an older Samsung Galaxy 2 android.  I downloaded netflix, and have been "casting" netflix movies onto a 32" Vizio Flat Screen mounted on my Master Bedroom wall.  Folks, I have fallen in love with TV again.  I'm watching Dexter, and movies from Discovery and BBC all via Netflix onto my TV all thanks to this little app.  I am not a blazing star when it comes to all the tech. details, and initially I had a few hiccups trying to get things onto the TV.  However, a few google searches on my old Dell Latitude got me the answers I needed.  I had attempted a call into Google Chrome Customer Support, but while on hold I found the answers online.  The portability will be amazing, and I intend to take the little device when I travel on vacation and business.  Hands Down, this is nearly idiot proof.  I haven't used it with youtube or any others such as of yet.  So wish Amazon Prime could be casted onto my TV, and maybe in time I can, but right now I believe not.  If anyone knows a very simplistic way of doing so please drop me a line.  Happy New Year everyone!
